newsitem.title: USA: Patterson Energy sets acquisition of rigs.
newsitem.headline: Patterson Energy sets acquisition of rigs.

text.p: Patterson Energy Inc said it has tentatively agreed to acquire the contract drilling operations of Wes-Tex Drilling Co, a privately owned Abilene, Texas, based company.

Under the terms of the agreement in principle, Patterson said, it would buy 21 drilling rigs, rig hauling trucks and trailers, and a yard and shop located in Abilene for $25 million in cash, 283,000 Patterson common shares and 200,000 warrants to purchase Patterson common exercisable at $32.00 per share.

Wes-Tex's drilling rigs, all of which are fully equipped and operable, are located primarily in West Texas and have drilling depth capacities of 8,000 to 15,000 feet. After this acquisition, Patterson's fleet will total 87 land drilling rigs, the company noted.
